Posts.Content: dipad wrote: Hi Ladies. I had BMX 1/3 with left auxilary node dissection. I also had immediate TE. I am still feeling tightness on chest area, but am also having a difficult time raising my left arm. It is very sore. I am taking warm showers and doing prescribed exercises 3x daily as well as Advil 3x daily. The nurse suggested physical therapy in next week if not better. i am so fristrated and want the soreness to ease up before chemo begins. Anyone out there doing PT and finding it helpful? Posts.Title: anyone doing PT? dipad Sassa

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2012 12:52AM dipad wrote: I'm going crazy with this also. I'm in the "grey Zone". had BMX in Jaunuary, 6 weeks chemo. my dx is 1.6 cm. 1 node out of 16. Stage 2, grade 3, braca-. her2-, er+. Onc cent me to RO because of new guidelines, however thy are not set in stone. There are variables. That's what can drive you crazy. The RO set no to rads and also presented the case to her peers at conference who also said no to RADS. I feel the oposite and am now going to look for 2nd opinion. I am 52 had hysterectomy last year but kept ovaries and was still getting my period like clockwork up until surgery. RO feels risks out weight benifits since bc on left breast cancer. However. i have read several studies that rads have improved. Good luck. Let me know how you make out

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2011 04:12PM dipad wrote: I had lumpectomy and SNB two weeks ago. Three lymph nodes were removed. One came back positive. 2 out of five margins not clear. Went from stage 1 to stage 2. Tumor size was 1.6 cm. Her2 neg. The breast surgeon wants to remove all lymph nodes on left. I'm concerned about lymphodema. I'll be having BMX next month and 8 rounds of Chemo. Any advice? I am thinking of going for 2nd opinion to BS, not sure why, but feel it's a good plan.
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: dipad wrote: I was diagnosed 6 weeks ago with stage 1. receptors ok. Doctor wanted me to have breast mri for further evaluation. Two suspicious areas on left breast were found. The report basically said that one area could be fybrocystic and lets wait and see with 6 month follow-up. Other area on left breast highly suspicious of invasicve carcinoma. Doctor decided to do MRI biopspy on only that area that is highly suspicious. I recieved good news today that the new area biopsied was negative. However, I am still worried about the " wait and see area". The doctor's office already scheduled me for lumpectomy next week. The doctor does not want to put off the surgery for another mri biopsy. I feel that I am jumping into this too quick. I'm concerned about having a wait and see attitude on a breast that already has cancer. She suggested that when she does the lumpectomy she can biopsy that area at the same time. If it comes back positive I would have to than have additional surgery. My question- do you think it's safe to wait another 2 weeks for surgery and have additional biopsies or have the lumpectomy and move forward from there? Dx 11/18/2011, IDC, 1cm, Stage II, 1/14 nodes, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Radiation Necessary marystnow55 purple32

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2012 09:48AM dipad wrote: SO CONFUSED. I met with the RO yesterday. She is against radiation. She said that usual protocal for rads is 4 or more lymph nodes involved or tumor over 4cm, or profile, i.e. BRACA or estrogen factors. I had one lymph node involved, 1.6 cm tumore, ER+, HER2- and BRACA neg. Yet I have spoke to many women with similar dx and they did rads. The RO said it furter cuts reoccurnece by 15%. Why wouldn't i want to do RADS? She said because my cancer was on left breast. 5% chance of heart disease. Geez I'm not sure what is the worst of two evils. My Onc had said guidelines were changed last year to 1 or more lymph nodes involved. Any advice?
Posts.Title: Radiation Necessary marystnow55 purple32
